page.title: 06CHRISTCHURCH CASTLE II
page.content: If any castles were built in those days they would have been built out of stone. At the beginning of the Civil War the castle was held by the Royalists. In April 1644{General {Waller's Parliamentarian}troops captured a hundred horses and four hundred infantry. Later the same year a{Royalist}general{Lord Goring attacked Christchurch but was beaten off. A few months later he attacked again and drove the Parliamentarian garrison into the church and castle, but he was forced out of the town. Then thirty tons of oak were sent to Christchurch for its defences but after the execution of{Charles 1}the Parliamentarian government feared that the castle might be used on behalf of his son,so they knocked most of it down.
